Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

entry.content:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

entry.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

entry.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

entry.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

entry.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

entry.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

entry.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

entry.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

entry.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

entry.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

entry.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

entry.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

entry.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

entry.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

entry.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

entry.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

entry.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

entry.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

entry.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

entry.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

entry.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

entry.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

entry.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

entry.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

entry.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

entry.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

entry.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

entry.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

entry.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
entry.content:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

entry.title: Genetic diversity fuels gene discovery for tobacco and alcohol use (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Genetic diversity fuels gene discovery for tobacco and alcohol use

A multi-ancestry meta-regression study analyses diverse genome-wide association studies and genome loci associated with tobacco and alcohol use.

  • Gretchen R. B. Saunders
  • Xingyan Wang
  • Scott Vrieze
Article Open Access 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Gigaelectronvolt emission from a compact binary merger (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Gigaelectronvolt emission from a compact binary merger

The observation of transient-like gigaelectronvolt emission in the high-energy gamma-rays of GRB 211211A, from the merger of two compact binary objects, is reported.

  • Alessio Mei
  • Biswajit Banerjee
  • Pawan Tiwari
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: A kilonova following a long-duration gamma-ray burst at 350 Mpc (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A kilonova following a long-duration gamma-ray burst at 350 Mpc

A possible kilonova associated with a nearby, long-duration gamma-ray burst suggests that gamma-ray bursts with long and complex light curves can be spawned from the merger of two compact objects, contrary to the established gamma-ray burst paradigm.

  • Jillian C. Rastinejad
  • Benjamin P. Gompertz
  • Christina C. Thöne
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: A signalling pathway for transcriptional regulation of sleep amount in mice (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A signalling pathway for transcriptional regulation of sleep amount in mice

Virus-mediated somatic genetics experiments in adult mouse brain identify key roles of LKB1 and SIK3 upstream of HDAC4/5 and CREB in the transcriptional regulation of non-rapid eye movement sleep.

  • Rui Zhou
  • Guodong Wang
  • Qinghua Liu
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Formation of robust bound states of interacting microwave photons (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Formation of robust bound states of interacting microwave photons

An experimental investigation of the dynamics of the spin ½ Floquet XXZ model finds bound states as predicted, and also robustness to noise and non-integrability when theoretical descriptions start to fail.

  • A. Morvan
  • T. I. Andersen
  • P. Roushan
Article Open Access 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: A plant-derived natural photosynthetic system for improving cell anabolism (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A plant-derived natural photosynthetic system for improving cell anabolism

Proof of concept of the viability of a plant-derived photosynthetic system based on nanothylakoid units encapsulated in a chondrocyte membrane to enhance cell anabolism in chondrocytes is demonstrated.

  • Pengfei Chen
  • Xin Liu
  • Xianfeng Lin
Article Open Access 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: A nearby long gamma-ray burst from a merger of compact objects (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A nearby long gamma-ray burst from a merger of compact objects

A bright, long-duration gamma-ray burst observed by the Swift observatory has hybrid high-energy properties, suggesting that its origin is the merger of a compact binary.

  • E. Troja
  • C. L. Fryer
  • A. J. Castro-Tirado
Article Open Access 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Close relatives of MERS-CoV in bats use ACE2 as their functional receptors (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Close relatives of MERS-CoV in bats use ACE2 as their functional receptors

NeoCoV and its close relative, PDF-2180, can efficiently bind to and use specific bat ACE2 orthologues and, less favourably, human ACE2 as entry receptors through their receptor-binding domains on the spike protein.

  • Qing Xiong
  • Lei Cao
  • Huan Yan
Article Open Access 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: In vitro production of infectious Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
In vitro production of infectious Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites

Plasmodium falciparum sporozoites produced in vitro recapitulate the P. falciparum life cycle from gametocyte to gametocyte without mosquitoes or primates.

  • Abraham G. Eappen
  • Tao Li
  • Stephen L. Hoffman
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Autoimmunity-associated T cell receptors recognize HLA-B*27-bound peptides (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Autoimmunity-associated T cell receptors recognize HLA-B*27-bound peptides

A study shows that cross-reactivity of microbial antigens and self-antigens presented by HLA-B*27 may be important in the pathogenesis of diseases associated with HLA-B*27 and identifies the shared binding motif responsible.

  • Xinbo Yang
  • Lee I. Garner
  • K. Christopher Garcia
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Structural variants drive context-dependent oncogene activation in cancer (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Structural variants drive context-dependent oncogene activation in cancer

Results are presented that indicate that alterations to gene regulatory three-dimensional architecture are a critical mechanism that enables structural variant-based oncogene activation in cancer genomes and sheds light on the essential elements for such gene activation events.

  • Zhichao Xu
  • Dong-Sung Lee
  • Jesse R. Dixon
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: A transcriptional switch controls sex determination in Plasmodium falciparum (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A transcriptional switch controls sex determination in Plasmodium falciparum

A non-genetic mechanism of sex determination in the human malaria parasite, Plasmodium falciparum, is described, and the male development 1 gene is identified as a potential target for interventions that block malaria transmission.

  • A. R. Gomes
  • A. Marin-Menendez
  • A. M. Talman
Article Open Access 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Microbial predators form a new supergroup of eukaryotes (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Microbial predators form a new supergroup of eukaryotes

Provora is an ancient supergroup of microbial predators that are genetically, morphologically and behaviourally distinct from other eukaryotes, and comprise two divergent clades of predators—Nebulidia and Nibbleridia—that differ fundamentally in ultrastructure, behaviour and gene content.

  • Denis V. Tikhonenkov
  • Kirill V. Mikhailov
  • Patrick J. Keeling
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Patterned cPCDH expression regulates the fine organization of the neocortex (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Patterned cPCDH expression regulates the fine organization of the neocortex

The diverse yet patterned expression of clustered protocadherins regulates the precise spatial arrangement and synaptic connectivity of excitatory neurons in the mouse neocortex.

  • Xiaohui Lv
  • Shuo Li
  • Song-Hai Shi
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Kinase signalling in excitatory neurons regulates sleep quantity and depth (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Kinase signalling in excitatory neurons regulates sleep quantity and depth

Forward genetics analyses and targeted genetic manipulation in mice show that regulation of sleep quantity and quality is mediated by the LKB1–SIK3–HDAC4–HDAC5 pathway.

  • Staci J. Kim
  • Noriko Hotta-Hirashima
  • Hiromasa Funato
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: CLSTN3β enforces adipocyte multilocularity to facilitate lipid utilization (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
CLSTN3β enforces adipocyte multilocularity to facilitate lipid utilization

An adipocyte-selective product of the Clstn3 locus (CLSTN3β) facilitates the use of stored triglyceride by limiting lipid droplet (LD) expansion, defining a molecular mechanism that regulates LD form and function to facilitate lipid utilization in thermogenic adipocytes.

  • Kevin Qian
  • Marcus J. Tol
  • Peter Tontonoz
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Widespread herbivory cost in tropical nitrogen-fixing tree species (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Widespread herbivory cost in tropical nitrogen-fixing tree species

Nitrogen-fixing trees are favoured by herbivorous animals relative to non-fixing trees, increasing their carbon opportunity cost and potentially constraining global nitrogen fixation.

  • Will Barker
  • Liza S. Comita
  • Sarah A. Batterman
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: A long-duration gamma-ray burst with a peculiar origin (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
A long-duration gamma-ray burst with a peculiar origin

Analysis of the long-duration GRB 211211A led to observations of emission properties differing from all known type I bursts, yet its multiband behaviour suggests a non-massive-star origin, pointing towards a new progenitor type.

  • Jun Yang
  • Shunke Ai
  • Hou-Jun Lü
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Plastic futures and their CO2 emissions (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Plastic futures and their CO2 emissions

Three alternative CO2 emission-mitigation pathways were analysed for the global plastics sector, covering their production to waste management. A circular bioeconomy strategy could achieve negative emissions in the long term, while at the same time allowing landfilling to be phased out and reducing resource consumption.

  • Paul Stegmann
  • Vassilis Daioglou
  • Martin Junginger
Article 07 Dec 2022

entry.title: Decoupling of respiration rates and abundance in marine prokaryoplankton (Nature - research articles)
entry.content:
Decoupling of respiration rates and abundance in marine prokaryoplankton

Cell-specific respiration rates differ by more than 1,000× among prokaryoplankton genera, and the majority of respiration was found to be performed by minority members of prokaryoplankton, whereas cells of the most prevalent lineages had extremely low respiration rates.

  • Jacob H. Munson-McGee
  • Melody R. Lindsay
  • Ramunas Stepanauskas
Article Open Access 07 Dec 2022
